intro: Euphrasia subpolaris, commonly known as the polar eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and subarctic regions. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant produces small, yellowish-orange flowers with prominent white veins, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It is adapted to cold climates and has a low-growing habit to survive harsh environmental conditions. Euphrasia subpolaris is often found in tundra and alpine habitats, where it plays a role in local ecosystems.
